feed.title: Non-disclosure of a consensus bug in btcd

entry.title: Non-disclosure of a consensus bug in btcd
entry.summary: In a recent publication, vital information regarding a vulnerability, identified as CVE-2024-38365, was shared in detail. This announcement came shortly after btcd made public their security advisory. For those interested in understanding the nuances and implications of this specific bug, referred to as the "findanddelete" bug within the btcd environment, comprehensive details can be found through this [detailed disclosure](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/cve-2024-38365-public-disclosure-btcd-findanddelete-bug/1184?u=antoinep). Additionally, btcd's own documentation and advisory on the matter provide further insight into the vulnerability and are accessible via their [security advisory page](https://github.com/btcsuite/btcd/security/advisories/GHSA-27vh-h6mc-q6g8), ensuring that stakeholders have all necessary information to understand and mitigate the risks associated with this issue.
